item.title: Collegerama
item.description: The lectures of the Orange track are now available on Collegerama. Please click on the folder Cloud your Identity.
item.dc:creator: Jarno

item.title: Symposium was a great succes
item.description: The symposium was a great succes. Currently, the symposium committee is collecting the presentation slides and these will be available on the website as soon as possible. Also, the Orange Track is recorded and will be available on Collegerama. There will be an announcement for this.
item.dc:creator: Jarno

item.title: Krzysztof Pietrzak replaces Ronald Cramer
item.description:
Ronald Cramer won't be able to attend the symposium, so his presentation will be replaced by a presentation on leakage-resilient cryptography, which will be given by Krzysztof Pietrzak.

On a side note, we passed 150 registrations this week and people are still registering. If you haven't registered already, you have until Monday 4pm. After that you can only buy your ticket at the symposium desk in the MustSee, on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: root

item.title: Program and Forum update
item.description:
The program schedule has undergone an update, you can find it here. Also the abstracts of the lectures are added and are available here.

Unfortunately Jérémie Zimmermann, as some might noticed at the Lecturers Page, is unable to attend the symposium due to his work for the European Union. The good news is that the lecture itself will remain the same thanks to dr. Philippe Aigrain, a colleague and co-founder of La Quadrature du Net, who will replace Jérémie Zimmermann.

At the forum we would like to start a discussion about privacy, law and ethics on certain topics. Dr.ir. Coen Vermeeren will be leading the discussions. The members of the panel will be announced later. We would like to thank Motiv for their advise and support which made this forum possible.
item.dc:creator: micheld

item.title: Newsletter: All lecturers known, registration will open this week
item.description:
We're pleased to be able to announce we now know all lecturers. It took us some time to confirm the last ones, but now it's finished and we can present you the full list. You can find it under Lecturers

Next to this joyful news, we are also gonna open registrations this week. You will get a new newsletter when that happens, which will also contain some explanation to the registration procedure.

We fully expect to see you on our symposium!
item.dc:creator: root

item.title: Newsletter: Lecturer selection almost ready
item.description:
We made some good progress, especially in contacting and confirming lecturers and their presentations for 'Cloud your Identity, Distribute your Life'. We know most lecturers already, and are almost done selecting the last ones. And on a side note, thanks to our sponsors NGI, Siemens and StuD, combined with the funding from the TU Delft, our financial situation is looking good.



read more
item.dc:creator: root

item.title: Symposium: Cloud your Identity, Distribute your Life
item.description:
This April 27th, W.I.S.V. 'Christiaan Huygens' organises a symposium for Applied Mathematics and Computer Science students at Delft University of Technology. On this website you will find information about the symposium, and in a few months you can also buy your ticket here.

To stay informed about the symposium, you can subscribe to our newsletter in the menu on your left. For unanswered questions on the website, you van reach us at symposium@ch.tudelft.nl.

The goal of this symposium is to give an overview of recent developments in distributed systems, Peer-2-Peer collaboration and cryptology, and mainly how these topics intersect law processes and privacy issues. Therefore, the symposium will not only cover current scientific research, but also social and philosophical topics related to it.

read more
item.dc:creator: root
